name: DarZahia

reviews.text: Zahia has asked me to keep her place a secret. Need I say anymore? We were there at the end of October for only two nights. Superb home, lovely oasis, lovely town, lovely people, Fatima is an amazing cook (hard to impress us, but she managed it). Do go, but don’t say I told you about it. Happy to answer any questions you may have.
reviews.title: Shhh! We need to keep this place a secret.

reviews.text: 9 days into our travels through Marrakesh and Fez, the 4 of us drove to Taroudant and called the Dar as advised. We were met by Bilaid who led us to Dar Zahia and welcomed us to this tranquil space. A really pleasant young man with a fantastically warm smile.
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.text: The Dar is impressively stylish. Having spent days among glorious tiles and stunning ceramics of Morocco, it was calming spending our time in the cream linens, drapes, cushions and stone plastered walls, with candles and greenery around a plunge pool. It felt cool and relaxing - a really special place to be.
reviews.title: Don't Leave...

reviews.text: Our eldest daughter had left Marrakesh with an upset stomach and both Fatima, the delightful cook, and Bilaid were on hand with verbena tea (on the house) and offers of local medical help if needed. After a few days our daughter made a full recovery but it had been the most perfect place for recuperation!
reviews.title: The heaven in Taroundant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Zahia called to ask if all was okay and was able to suggest ideas for our onward travel and to find gems of beaches in Sidi Ifni. We felt very well looked afer and would love to return to the Dar again one day.
reviews.title: An exquisite place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were guests at DarZahia in Taroudant both before and after driving to M'hamid for a Sahara adventure. Zahia was in Paris during our stay at her wonderful guest house but she was extremely responsive and supportive from initial contact for booking through our stay and even after our return home. Her beautiful courtyard style house was a delight with lovely sitting areas, cascading floral greenery filled with birdsongs, the calls of neighboring sheep, goats and chickens as well as the visits by the friendly, well-behaved resident cat. Our ground floor room with on-suite shower was very comfortable while the upstairs rooms and shared bath also looked very appealing. The staff, Fatima and Belaïd, were very patient with our inadequate French, looking after us very well and providing fabulous meals on the roof terrace in daytime and in a lovely dining room with a fireplace in the evenings. The highlight of our second stay was an unforgettable evening arranged by Zahia for a milestone birthday celebration. The main event was a performance of Berber music and dancing provided by the Roudaniates de Taroudant, a famous, world-toured very talented women's ensemble. This was followed by a wonderful meal for all the musicians and guests complete with a huge birthday cake. Zahia had ensured it would be a really festive event by inviting some of her charming local friends as well as having her staff invite their families. Fatima was the best dancer! Taroudant and its inhabitants provided a wonderful authentic Moroccan experience. We plan to return to Morocco and look forward to staying again at DarZahia.
reviews.title: Guest house par excellence in Taroudant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay at DarZahia. From the first email with Zahia, the proprietor, to saying goodbye to staff members Younes and Fatima after a perfect one-night stay, everything was a pleasure. Zahia took a lot of time to suggest local excursions and answer questions promptly before we arrived. Younes and Fatima provided the best experience of our trip while we were there. They made us feel completely at home, both at the guest house and in Taroudant. The ambiance was peaceful, with many nooks for sitting and reading or talking and drinking tea, with the resident cat, Bizmat, purring next to us. Breakfast was served by the fire at a big wooden table with lots of design books for leisurely reading--just what we needed on a cool morning in the desert. We wished we could have stayed much longer and hope to go back next year. All in all, it was our best experience of the trip.
reviews.title: Best stay of our trip
Not just an hotel, but our home away from home.
reviews.text: Located in the heart of Medina, within a walking distance from the Berber and Arab Suk, Dar Zahia is a perfect hot spot in Taroudant. After a stressful period I needed a place for a deep relax. I picked up DarZahia among multiple possible charming places and discovered a real oasis away from everything, that I strongly recommend. Nothing more to say, just live it! DGO

I went to Dar Zahia with friends for one week in march 2009 and I was really surprised when I saw the place. It is real oasis of minimalistic luxury with small but lovely rooms made with a lot of taste, lovely common spaces and very professional service.
reviews.title: One week at Dar Zahia

description: DarZahia, peaceful and quiet, welcomes its guests in the freshness of a lush garden.
